Instructions.text: Metal Recovery is the real deal. Now you will learn one of the most important performance calculations related to flotation.
One way of calculating Metal Recovery is by dividing the Enrichment Ratio (Concentrate grade / Feed grade) by the Concentration Ratio.

In a flotation process that the Feed Cu % is 1 while the Concentrate Cu % is 2, and the concentration ratio is 2, what would be the Metal Recovery?
 Recovery =
 Concentrate Metal Grade * 100 / ((Feed Metal Grade) * Concentration Ratio )

Assuming your Concentration Ratio is 5, calculate the recovery of your process (you can round the values). Open the Concentrate Graphs. Does your value match the Cu Recovery displayed?
 Recovery =
 Concentrate Metal Grade * 100 / ((Feed Metal Grade) * Concentration Ratio )

True. Let's assume that your Conc. grade is 4%, Feed grade is 1% and Concentration Ratio is 5. Your recovery would be (4 / 5 ) * 100 = 80%. With a Conc. grade of 5% you would get (5 / 5 ) * 100 = 100% recovery.

But your Concentration ratio (Feed tons/ Conc. tons) was not really 5. Change the parameters to get a Conc. Ratio of 10, then do the math again. Does it match now?
 Recovery =
 Concentrate Metal Grade * 100 / ((Feed Metal Grade) * Concentration Ratio )

It should match because that's how the values of this simulation are generated ;) Even though there are other ways of calculating Metal Recovery, I am going to leave you with this simple approach, just because it doesn't require a calculator or other parameters like tailings' values.
